summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from October 2019 between attorney Gloria Allred and federal prosecutors regarding a new alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails coordinate logistics for the victim to attend an FBI Victim Services meeting in New York and to be interviewed by prosecutors.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: High-profile attorney communicating with the U.S. Attorney's Office to arrange for a new client, an alleged Epstein victim, to attend an FBI victim meeting and be interviewed.

persons.name: Daniel
persons.context: Mentioned as joining a scheduled conference call regarding the victim.

persons.name: Marianne Wang
persons.context: Attorney whose office (via Daniel) is involved in the coordination call.

connections.description: Daniel, from co-counsel Marianne Wang's office, is scheduled to join a conference call coordinated by Allred.
Allred references Marianne Wang's office as co-counsel involved in the case.

events.title: FBI Victim Services Meeting in New York
events.description: A meeting organized by the FBI's Victim Services for alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein. Gloria Allred's new client was willing to fly to New York to attend.

events.title: Scheduled Interview/Conference Call
events.description: A planned 4:00 PM conference call (later potentially rescheduled) between Gloria Allred, her client, co-counsel, and federal prosecutors to discuss the new alleged victim.

events.title: Proposed Interview with Victim
events.description: Prosecutors planned to interview Allred's new client, either at the FBI office or at Allred's office, following the victim services meeting.

locations: 305 Broadway, New York, NY (Gloria Allred's office suite 607)
6300 Wilshire Blvd., Suite 1500, Los Angeles, CA 90048 (Allred, Maroko & Goldberg law firm)
1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office)
New York, NY (Location of FBI Victim Services meeting)
Washington, D.C. (Destination for Allred's train travel)
keyFacts: In October 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death, attorney Gloria Allred was actively engaging with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding a new, previously unreported alleged victim.
The FBI was organizing a Victim Services meeting in New York on October 23, 2019, and was handling travel logistics for victims to attend.
The correspondence shows active coordination between a victim's attorney and federal law enforcement to secure victim testimony and participation in the ongoing investigation post-Epstein's death.
Multiple individuals' names (AUSAs, FBI agents) are redacted in the document, indicating the sensitivity of the ongoing investigation and witness identities.

The emails reveal the practical logistics involved, such as securing flight arrangements, scheduling interviews around tight attorney travel schedules, and using secure communication methods for sensitive calls.
